snippet: People who took part in a sterilization drive in the state of Chhattisgarh that led to 13 deaths described an assembly-line atmosphere with little regard for hygiene.
abstract: Thirteen Indian women die after taking part in government-run sterilization drive in state of Chhattisgarh; possible explanations have arisen for deaths, such as inadequate sterilization of instruments, bacteria in the operating room and tainted medications; surgeon Dr R K Gupta is arrested on charges of culpable homicide.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SUHASINI RAJ
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from Amsena, and Suhasini Raj from New Delhi. Hari Kumar contributed reporting from Bilaspur, India.

lead_paragraph: People who took part in a sterilization drive in the state of Chhattisgarh that led to 13 deaths described an assembly-line atmosphere with little regard for hygiene.

headline.main: Web of Incentives in Fatal Indian Sterilizations
headline.print_headline: Payments for Sterilization, and 13 Women Dead
